founders.name: Michael Widenius
founders.background: Co-founder and CTO of MySQL, with experience in database programming

team.network_strength: Strong community involvement and partnerships with several technology companies

market.TAM: Global database market estimated at billions
market.SAM: Focused market share in open-source and lower-cost segments

product.stage: Production with ongoing R&D in version 4.1 and 5.0
product.USP: Open-source model with dual licensing, high performance, and reliability
product.customer_acquisition: Deploying GPL software to gain market penetration and reduce acquisition costs

traction.user_growth: Significant growth with installations in major companies like Yahoo and Google
traction.engagement: High engagement with a large active open-source community

testimonials: Yahoo and Google run operations on MySQL
Used by major corporations like 7-Eleven and Amazon

financial_efficiency.burn_rate: Not specified directly, but focused on profitability
financial_efficiency.CAC_vs_LTV: Low customer acquisition cost due to open-source strategy
financial_efficiency.unit_economics: Strong, with dual licensing model balancing free and commercial offerings

miscellaneous.timing_fad_risk: Open-source model mitigates timing and fad risks
